intro: Encholirium ascendens, commonly known as the ascending lily, is a striking plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Alstroemeriaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height. The plant produces large, showy white or pink flowers with prominent stamens, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, arranged in a rosette at the base. Encholirium ascendens is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain.
